title: Deli Manager
description:
Deli Managers are responsible for managing the deli department operations to enhance guest satisfaction, achieve sales goals, and achieve profitability goals; while providing excellent guest service. This position is responsible for maintaining open communication on the status of the department with the General Manager, Clerks, and Supervisor. Will be expected to set and re-set priorities, distinguish between the urgent and the important, solve problems, hold and reconcile ideas and lead program development as well as advancement strategies from conception through cultivation to completion. Must be available weekdays, weekends, and holidays for various shifts. May work at another store location based on company needs. Should have at least 3+ years of experience.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  
\\* Ensures clerks exemplify superior guest service with a friendly, helpful, and courteous attitude, using product knowledge and information to answer all questions guests may have about products  
\\* Supervise, develop, train, and manage deli department team members  
\\* Contribute to store sales and profitability by effectively managing labor expenses, accurate pricing, stock levels, inventory, and merchandising  
\\* Maintain compliance with all company policies and regulations pertaining to safety, sanitation, merchandising, and food quality  
\\* Ensure product integrity through proper storing, handling, proofing, planning, and breaking out of all deli goods  
\\* Responsible for inventory control, ordering, and maintaining proper merchandise levels  
\\* Prepare sales and inventory report  
\\* Communicate and work cooperatively with General Manager, other Department Managers, and team members to maintain standards and exceed guest expectations  
\\* Ensure equipment is maintained and properly serviced  
\\* Advise General Manager of equipment repair or replacement needs  
\\* Ensure productivity standards are met without compromising product quality  
\\* Make regular announcements to inform guests of freshly prepared deli products and current sales  
\\* Maximizing sales through excellent guest service and minimizing shrink through proper utilization of procedures  
\\* Display a nice, energetic, creative, and motivated attitude at all times  
\\* Assists all department team members with daily responsibilities while leading by example to help ensure a safe, clean, and productive operation  
\\* Other duties as required  
Position Requirements  
\\* Thorough knowledge of the retail food business and perishable department operations  
\\* Previous food service and management experience preferred  
\\* Ability to make timely and effective decisions  
\\* Ability to deal tactfully and effectively with guests and associates  
\\* Thorough understanding of all safety requirements and company safety policies  
\\* Excellent guest service skills  
\\* Must greet the guests and respond to their questions and requests in a courteous, fast, and helpful way  
\\* Proven leadership ability to exercise sound judgement in interpreting, communicating, and applying policy.  
\\* Courage to make and implement hard decisions in a timely manner.  
\\* Ability to demonstrate trustworthiness and integrity in daily activities  
\\* Ability to work effectively with a broad diversity of individuals and backgrounds, and generational differences, all with the intent to support the core values of the BFL company.  
\\* Excellent oral and written communication, organizational, interpersonal, advocacy, and time management skills.  
\\* Display a willingness to become knowledgeable of the organizational structure, policies, procedures, and be a contributing team member.

JOB PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  
\\* Individual will be exposed to extreme heat from ovens and fryers, and cold from freezers and coolers  
\\* Visual acuity sufficient to read recipes, product labels, company manual, department policies, and reports  
\\* Must be able to lift a minimum of 45 lbs. frequently  
\\* Ability to bend, reach, kneel, and squat  
\\* Able to push or pull heavy loads  
\\* Able to stand for long periods of time

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 43 – 48 per week

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Have you worked as a Deli Manager previously?

Experience:

* Deli Management: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Home School Tutor
description:
**Homeschool Tutor for Two Students with Dyslexia**

**Location:** Colts Neck, NJ

**Start Date:** ASAP

**Tutoring Schedule:**

Monday to Thursday, 8 AM - 12 PM/1 PM

**Position Overview:**

We are looking for a dynamic tutor to work with Ryan (age 12, 7th grade) and Jeremy (age 11, 6th grade). The ideal candidate will use effective teaching strategies tailored to each student's needs, focusing on dyslexia support using methods such as Orton-Gillingham and Wilson.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide one-on-one tutoring sessions for Ryan and Jeremy in a home setting.
* Use visual learning techniques and structured lesson plans to accommodate each student’s learning style.
* Implement Orton-Gillingham/Wilson methods to support students with dyslexia.
* Engage students with their interests in science, math, gymnastics, and guitar to foster motivation and enthusiasm for learning.
* Adapt teaching methods to meet each student’s individual needs and learning preferences.
* Collaborate with parents to provide regular feedback on student progress and adjust teaching strategies as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience working with students with dyslexia, particularly using Orton-Gillingham or Wilson methods.
* Strong background in visual learning strategies.
* Ability to design structured lesson plans and provide individualized support.
* Passion for working with middle school students and helping them achieve their academic goals.
* Excellent communication skills and a patient, supportive approach.

**Preferred Attributes:**

* Previous experience in a homeschooling environment.
* Familiarity with Christian educational values.
* Ability to create a positive and encouraging learning environment.
* Flexibility and adaptability to work with two students with different learning needs.

**Additional Information:**

* The tutoring sessions will take place in a quiet, private homeschooling area at the student’s home.
* The home has two cats and one dog.

**How to Apply:** If you are enthusiastic about making a difference in the lives of students with dyslexia and meet the qualifications listed, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining your relevant experience and teaching philosophy.

Thank you!

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
To carry out laboratory tests and operate laboratory equipment under the supervision of a bioanalytical lab director. Examine body fluid samples in a laboratory setting to detect alcohol, drugs and other substances in clients in a drug and alcohol treatment center. Provide information for client diagnosis and treatment by performing laboratory tests in toxicology.

*Responsibilities include but are not limited to:* 

· Keep laboratory and all equipment clean

· Prepare laboratory equipment and specimens for testing and analysis

· Store samples under controlled conditions for future use when necessary

· Organize work by matching computer orders with specimen labeling, sorting specimens, checking labeling, logging specimens, arranging reports for delivery and keeping work surfaces clean and orderly

· Identify the presence or quantity of drugs of abuse, therapeutic drugs and toxic substances by operating toxicology instrumentation and send one sample per client per week to confirmation lab as well as any positive specimens for confirmation testing

· Analyze and record test results in Kipu and desktop analyzer spreadsheet in Egnyte

· Identify and communicate abnormal patent conditions by alerting supervisor, clinical

· Maintain client confidence by keeping laboratory information confidential while maintaining professional standards and abiding by local, state and federal requirements and JCAHO standards

· Monitor supplies and alert administration of supplies as needed

· Participate in staff meetings, development and trainings when appropriate

· Collaborate with professionals both within and outside the agency, as appropriate

· Demonstrate sensitivity and responsiveness to cultural differences

· Abide by SOBA code of ethics and model values

· Degree in Medical or Laboratory Technology from an accredited institution

· Certification as a Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT)

· Sound knowledge of analytical test procedures

· Adequate knowledge of standard techniques to collect samples

· Adequate computer skills since working with spreadsheets and word processing

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and strong team working skills

· Self-starter and self-reliant

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities. In the course of performing this job, one typically spends time sitting, walking, standing, driving, listening, speaking, typing, reading and writing. In addition, an employee may be asked to carry or lift **up to 20 lbs.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $26.13 - $30.63 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Member Sales Specialist
description:
**Member Sales Specialist**  

  

Are you ready to be a part of the most supportive fitness family in the world? We are excited to meet you and invite you to build a career in the fitness industry!  

  

Member Sales Responsibilities:  

  

* Lead generation and nurturing: networking, community outreach, referrals, phone calls, emails, texts, etc.
* New member signups
* Tour and Trial Booking
* Trial follow up and conversions

Creating and executing internal referral lead generation program  
* 

Member Relations Responsibilities:  

  

* Continued support, interactions, and communication with members after signup, driving engagement and progress
* Assist members with scheduling their 1-1 fitness coaching appointments and signature studio classes
* Ensure that members check in when arriving to the facility, while monitoring status of member programs

Maintain the cleanliness and order of the front desk area and ensure the members have a great club experience  
* 

Objectives:  

  

* Meet club sales & lead goals
* Provide a great member experience
* Assist management as needed

Ensure members are giving an NPS score of 8 or higher  
* 

Required Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:  

  

* Strong critical thinking ability with great multi-tasking skills required
* Create and build strong relationships with people
* Passion for helping people feel healthy, happy and strong
* Doesn’t mind rejection, rather sees it as a step to getting a yes
* Self motivated and driven to achieve set goals
* Prefers working with a team that becomes a second family
* So passionate about helping people stay healthy that overcoming their objections, fears and hesitations comes naturally

Good with technology and software  
* 

Position Requirements:  

  

* 2 years sales experience minimum (prefer 5 years)
* Full and part time positions available (minimum 20 hours per week)
* Morning, evening and weekend hours will be required as necessary

Must be career minded and desire to grow with the company long term  
* 

Total On Target Earnings - $30-$55 an hour  

  

Perks:  

  

* Complimentary 1:1 personal training session weekly
* Complimentary full access to facilities and amenities
* PTO Based on hours worked
* Discount on apparel and merchandise

Healthcare reimbursement plan  
* 

  

Ambassador Bonus Opportunity (Is performed outside of hourly shifts scheduled):  

  

* $20 per lead
* $20 per tour

title: Route Driver and labor
description:
Unleash your potential with a career at 1-800-GOT-JUNK? the World’s Largest Junk Removal Service, known for our professional, friendly team members and clean, shiny blue trucks. Our team members thrive within a culture of safety, learning, and entrepreneurship. Earn great pay while getting a great workout and providing a valuable service to your community.  

  

**What We Offer:**  

  

**Flexible Scheduling**: **(We operate 7 days a week)**  

Full-time - 4 Shifts per week ( 8-12 hour shifts)  

Part-time- 2-3 Shifts per week ( still 8-12 hour shifts)  

Immediate start dates & paid training  

  

**Pay (Hour rate + Tips + Performance Based Bonus)**  

Total Average Earnings: $19 - $24/hour  

  

**Performance Bonus:** Our bonus is better known as “Profit Share” Meaning, you make a percentage from the jobs you complete. What better way to ensure you are both paid well, but also based on the level of effort you have put into each job  

  

**Perks:**  

Premium Healthcare Reimburse Program (HRA)  

Flexible schedule  

Paid training  

Take home cool finds  

Referral bonus  

Team competitions / Bonus for top performance  

Attainable room for growth within the company  

Company uniform proved (Shirt/Hat)  

Great company culture and leadership team  

  

**A typical day includes:**


* The day starts with a commercial vehicle inspection, followed by a morning meeting.
* Teams of two will head out in our shiny blue trucks to visit customers’ homes and properties and take away their unwanted items while leaving smiles on their faces
* Provide detailed estimates/quotes and final pricing to each customer
* Once your truck is full, you will dispose of items responsibly through our recycling, donating, and waste management facilities
* To run efficiently, teams must maintain communication throughout the day with our dedicated and fun operations team
* Feel amazing about helping your community

  

  

**What you bring to the company:**


* You are 21+ years of age (Required for commercial truck Insurance)
* Possess a valid driver’s license (No CDL Required!)
* Have a clean driving history clean 3-years (No points, suspensions, or violations)
* Possess a positive and friendly attitude, with excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Physically able to lift 50lbs+ repeatedly
* Previous sales and customer service experience will aid in the success of our team

  

  

We have positions available immediately. We contact all qualified applicants within 2-4 business days for an interview. Successful candidates are offered employment within 24 hours of the interview and can start this or next week (or a future date if that’s more convenient).  

  

**Apply today to begin your journey with 1-800-GOT-JUNK?!**

title: Service Drive and Labor
description:
We are a full-service premiere Junk Removal company in Central NJ. We are actively looking to grow our team.


**We are looking for** goal-driven individuals with a valid non-CDL license to join our truck team. We offer 4 day work weeks, overtime opportunities, a genuine team atmosphere, attainable room for growth and many perks!


**What you will be doing:**


* Driving our Isuzu NPR 20 ft trucks
* Talking with customers and providing price estimates onsite
* Removing the quoted items from the premises, carry/lift into our truck
* Recycle, donate and dispose of items picked up at the appropriate facilities
* Staying fit & Feel amazing about helping your community


**Flexible Shifts:**


We offer both Part-time (1-3 Shifts per week) and Full-time (4 Shifts per week) + Overtime opportunities. We ask all team members to be available to work a minimum of 1 weekend per month, allowing us to rotate all employees.


**Hours:**


Our truck teams typically work an average of 10-12 hours each shift; 7:30am start time


**Pay:**


$16/hr base pay, PLUS AWESOME TIPS!


On top of hourly pay and your tips, we will pay you an additional $2-$8/hr (profit share) depending on how many pick-ups completed, and fun performance bonuses, and keep some cool finds!


**Employees' average earnings are 18-$24/hour each shift + cash tips.**


**Perks:**


Healthcare Reimbursement Arrangement, $10K Employee Scholarship Program, Amazing Leadership, attainable Advancement Opportunities, Flexible schedule, Keep some cool finds.


**Qualifications & Requirements:**


* Valid non-CDL Driver's license with no points deducted
* Positive-minded with a friendly yet professional personality
* Reliable, goal-driven, and hardworking
* Physically able to remove and lift heavy items from properties into our trucks
* Excited to be a part of a growing team


**If you have experience in one of these disciplines, please apply!**


* Construction
* General Labor
* Warehouse
* Moving
* Demolition
* Driver / Driving


We are happy to train hard-working individuals! Submit your resume for review today!

title: Shipping Specialist - Warehouse
description:
A&M Industrial is a family-owned leading local industrial distribution company looking for career-oriented individuals to fill critical positions their warehouse logistics staff. The growth of the company has created full time opportunities in their distribution center in Cranbury, NJ. New employees receive training and opportunities to grow as the company grows.

The company offers medical and dental benefits as well as 401K, paid holidays and vacation.

* Verifies and Audits all items for sales order shipments.
* Prepare and pack orders for shipment via Ground, LTL, domestic or international
* Carefully and accurately maintains shipping records for requested categories.
* Prepares bills of lading and schedules truck/carrier deliveries on-line or via phone
* Mark and label skids/containers as needed
* Shrink wrap items as needed
* Wrap skids with machine or manually as needed
* Transports materials to shipping dock with a pallet jack or hand truck as needed.
* Loads trucks using a forklift, if needed
* Maintain clean and safe work area
* Performs other warehouse and clerical duties.

A&M Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Requirements

* Requirements
* Must be Safety Conscious
* Previous Warehouse Experience
* Ability to work in fast paced environment with good organizational skills and attention to detail
* Possess experience or certification in handling forklifts, reach trucks, cherry pickers, and other warehouse equipment
* Team Player and Self-Motivated
* Good Communication and Problem Solving Skills
* Possess good Hand-Eye Coordination.
* Ability to use ladders safely and effectively.
* Able to maintain a high level of physicality for prolonged periods of time.
* Proficient in computers
* Fluent in English
* Experience with RF a plus
* Attendance and Punctuality a must
* Available to work overtime, if required
* Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.
* Must be able to work in a variety of weather conditions and temperatures in the warehouse and on the loading dock

**Please don't call about the job! Offer of employment is conditional upon successfully completing a drug test and background check.**

title: Assistant Director, Science , Regulatory and Advocacy
description:
**Position Overview**

The successful candidate will be action-oriented, have strong business acumen, experience in dynamic environments, the ability to work through ambiguity and an understanding of OmniActive’s mission and values. Experience in Science and Regulatory Affairs in Dietary Supplements, OTC and/or Pharmaceuticals is preferred.

**Job Purpose & Scope** 

* Guide and support product formulation and claims compliance as per available clinical evidence and in alignment with local regulatory requirements with a focus on North America
* Review and approve product labels and advertising copy/collaterals
* Interface with Trade Associates and Academic institutions to support advocacy and horizon scanning efforts

**Key Accountabilities**

**Science and Regulatory Compliance (85%):**

* Ensure published information and promotional/advertising material including claims meet country-specific regulatory requirements
* Manage product market fit maps as per local regulatory requirements
* Support publication strategy (preclinical, clinical and safety data) to support regulatory submissions
* Review label information as per local regulatory requirements
* Manage and support regulatory registrations, submissions and notifications with a focus on North America

**Advocacy (15%):**

* Interface with Trade Associations and Academic Institutions to support advocacy and horizon scanning efforts focused on science, public policy and regulations

**Skills & Competencies**

* Business Acumen
* Scientific Knowledge
* Familiarity with Regulations

Full-Time

title: Receiving Specialist - Warehouse
description:
A&M Industrial is a 70-year-old, family-owned leading local industrial distribution company looking for career-oriented individuals to fill critical positions their warehouse logistics staff. The growth of the company has created full time opportunities in their distribution center in Cranbury, NJ. New employees receive training and opportunities to grow as the company grows.

The company offers medical and dental benefits as well as 401K, paid holidays and vacation.

* Receives goods and verifies the quality and count of all items offloaded from LTL, UPS and Fed Ex deliveries.
* Checks deliveries against supplier's count, Bill of Lading and packing slip and inspects for any damage
* Open boxes and break down skids to verify that material matches supplier paperwork
* Using RF system, receives in material, stages and put away within warehouse
* Notifies Customer Service of major discrepancies, over-shipments, or substitutions per company policy
* Wrap Skids (Manual and using Stretch Wrap Machine)
* Maintain clean and safe work area.
* Performs other warehouse duties.

A&M Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Requirements

* Must be Safety Conscious
* Previous Warehouse Experience
* Ability to work in fast paced environment with good organizational skills and attention to detail
* Possess experience or certification in handling forklifts, reach trucks, cherry pickers, and other warehouse equipment
* Team Player and Self-Motivated
* Good Communication and Problem Solving Skills
* Possess good Hand-Eye Coordination.
* Ability to use ladders safely and effectively.
* Able to maintain a high level of physicality for prolonged periods of time.
* Proficient in computers
* Fluent in English
* Experience with RF a plus
* Attendance and Punctuality a must
* Available to work overtime, if required
* Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.
* Must be able to work in a variety of weather conditions and temperatures in the warehouse and on the loading dock

title: Vendor Management Specialist
description:
**Overview**
------------

The Vendor Management Specialist will support the head of Vendor Management by managing a portfolio of vendors throughout all phases of the vendor life cycle. The position will ensure that assigned vendors are selected, onboarded, monitored, renewed and terminated in accordance with Company policy in order to minimize the Company’s exposure to risk.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Manage a portfolio of multiple vendor engagements across all departments, while driving operational efficiencies and providing excellent client services
* Build and maintain long-lasting relationships with vendors
* Negotiate product pricing and contracts with vendors. Assist with updating, renewing, and canceling vendor contracts
* Communicate product-related issues and concerns to vendors
* Research new vendors in the market
* Facilitate communications between vendors and stakeholders
* Track vendor performance and mitigating actions. Compile reports, as needed
* Support resolution of vendor activities, inquiries, issues, incidents, service requests, and escalations
* Maintain vendor and contract data in the system of record (Venminder) and ensure reports and performance targets are met, reported, and submitted from vendors to be uploaded in the system
* Coordinate with Accounts Payable to assure that vendors are fully reviewed before initial payment
* Manage the periodic review of vendors and track expiring due diligence, insurance and tax documentation
* Assist in reviewing, updating and enhancing vendor management procedures
* Keep abreast of US and EU regulatory requirements
* Perform other related duties as assigned


**Qualifications**
------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in relevant curriculum, legal, compliance, finance, or risk management preferred
* Three plus years in Procurement and Vendor Management or related field
* Experience in vendor management or procurement preferred. Certification in third party risk management preferred (CTPRP, CRVPM)
* Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel
* Experience with Vendminder vendor management software preferred


**Skills**
----------

* Experience effectively engaging with leadership and influencing internal stakeholders
* Ability to work in a constantly changing environment and manage priorities according to changing strategic objectives
* Ability to multitask and work well as part of a global team.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, communication and interpersonal skills
* Excellent presentation skills
* Strong analytical and negotiation skills
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Ability to offer improved customer service

title: FP&A Co-Op
description:
**Excellence Wanted.**
======================


**About Us.**



Nice-Pak is more than just a Nice Place to Work, and we owe it to our amazing team of nice people to ensure we are hiring new team members who can do more than just meet expectations. We aim to hire excellence.



At Nice-Pak, we manufacture products that touch (literally!) a person's every stage of life - from birth through adulthood to retirement - and worldwide! We are a leading manufacturer of wipes for major grocery, discount, drug, big box, and club membership retailers, and we care deeply about our associates and customers. We care about our environment, too, which is why we stand by our commitment to sustainably source the materials that make our wipes work and support sustainable forestry through education and community engagement.



We live by our purpose of *Creating products for a cleaner, healthier world*, and it’s important to us that each time we add someone to our Nice-Pak family, we do so with our purpose statement in mind so we can achieve a workforce as special as our customer base.


### **About the Job.**


**Why This Job is Important.**



Working remotely, the FP&A Co-Op will Support the FP&A team on projects involving Excel.


**What You Can Expect.** In this role, you will:



At all times, comply with the Nice-Pak Code of Integrity and Professional Conduct.


* Review cost center spend and update reports and annual forecasts
* Prepare postmortem financial analysis on new product launches and share findings with the cross-functional leadership team.
* Update and maintain Nice-Pak customer broker & vendor agreement trackers.
* Assist on multiple reconciliations for month end.
* Update Capex monthly expenditures and forecast.
* Responsible for various financial reports, including waste, spoilage, and customer/category reports.
* Ad hoc financial analysis, including cost requests, audits, and cost center spend analysis.


**What We Expect from You in the Role:**


**This is what you can count on from us:**


* A safe and supportive work environment with a focus on continuous improvement.
* We want you to succeed and will invest in you and your career.
* You can count on us to encourage diversity, equity, and an atmosphere of inclusion.
* Great benefits that start when you do, including 401(k) match, and vision, medical and dental coverage. We also offer tuition reimbursement and many other supplemental benefits.
* Competitive pay commensurate with experience, plus bonus opportunities.
* Develop and present project findings to the CFO and FP&A team.
* Salary: $30/hour


**The non-negotiable things.**


* No shortcuts are allowed. We expect you to support our culture of safety and hold others accountable for it, even if it is uncomfortable.
* The law. Nice-Pak adheres to all local, state, and federal laws, and we expect every associate to do the same.
* You will work with many people, so you must be able to communicate respectfully, professionally, and purposefully, both in writing and verbally.
* You must be committed to caring for our people – co-workers and customers. This means being a good listener, conducting yourself ethically, providing feedback respectfully, and being honest and fair.


**The Important HR and Legal Stuff:** Nice-Pak is an equal opportunity employer. We hire the most qualified individuals and do not tolerate discriminatory behavior. We adhere to ADA standards and will review reasonable accommodations to support our employees. Pre-employment screenings, including drug tests, may be conducted as allowed by law.


**Apply Now:** If you are passionate about product safety and looking to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply and join our Nice-Pak family. Help us continue to provide safe and effective products that improve the lives of our customers around the world.



For more details and to apply, visit our careers page at Nice-Pak Careers.


*Nice-Pak is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.*

  



 Visit us at LinkedIn

  



#LI-SC1



#LI-NICEPAK


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Behavior Technician
description:
We are seeking a kind and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to work with a fun-loving young adult male who enjoys parks, bowling, theater, horse riding, skating, and car rides. Your role will involve accompanying and assisting him in these activities, volunteering together, providing some daily living assistance, and engaging in community outings. The ideal candidate must be comfortable working outdoors or in the community in various weather conditions.

Training will be provided, but prior experience working with individuals with Autism is preferred. The individual is nonspeaking and communicates through typing. He requires supervision and occasional hands-on support for daily living tasks. Communication training will be provided by the family.

**Location:**

* Edison, NJ 08837 (some times)
* Dayton, NJ 08810 (most of the times)

*(Transportation not required)*

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide client education and training to help develop skills needed for community participation, consistent with the client’s service plan. This includes building problem-solving, self-help, social, adaptive, daily living, and leisure skills.
* Understand and implement behavioral treatment plans as needed.
* Assist in creating weekly activity schedules and planning community-based activities that align with the client's preferences and needs.
* Facilitate the development of ADL (Activities of Daily Living) skills, including activities such as skating, bowling, cycling, walks, and shopping at local stores like Wegmans and Dollar Tree.
* Support the client in making popcorn, one of his favorite activities.
* Assist the individual as a Communication Facilitator, utilizing his primary modes of communication (iPad, letterboard using the Rapid Prompting Method, and/or communication software) to ensure active participation in scheduled activities and effective communication with instructors, peers, employers, and others.

**Qualification Requirements:**

* Certification as a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT).
* One (1) year of experience working with individuals with Autism.
* Flexible schedule for the right candidate.
* Availability on weekdays ( from 9:30 am onwards)
* 14-20 hours per week.

**Compensation:**

* Initial training rate: $20 to $25 per hour.
* Additional increases available after 9 months.

* Monday to Saturday
* Weekend availability

title: Robotics Clinical Account Representative (New York City)
description:
Robotics Account Representative (New York City)
Life Unlimited. At Smith+Nephew we design and manufacture technology that takes the limits off living.
Are you a relationship builder and desire to be part of the future of healthcare? If so, the future is here, and the time is now! This role leads the way for clinical implementation and utilization for the CORI Robot for knee and RI Hip navigated solutions.
What will you be doing?
You will be the technical expert for CORI launches providing case coverage and account support for new and existing customers by training surgeons and hospital staff to technological proficiency. You are a key player of the Orthopedics organization as we focus on driving the adoption and utilization of CORI for knee & hip arthroplasty. You will also identify leads and drive revenue in partnership with the Joint Reconstruction and Capital sales organizations in your designated territory and nationally.
What will you need to be successful?
The success of the organization is in part due to your ability to build positive relationships with customers and internal team members while also being a trusted clinical expert in the operating room. Your success will be measured by your ability to train customers in an allotted timeframe, partake in labs and medical education events and completing certification standards. Successful candidates would need the following:* Post-secondary degree or equivalent experience (required)
* 2+ years of experience, preferably in the medical device industry, athletic training, physical therapy or engineering


Travel Requirements: within designated territory with 2-4 overnights a week. Infrequent national travel for events and conferences*All field sales professionals that are required to gain entry into healthcare facilities to perform the basic remit of their role, must successfully complete our credentialling process, which often includes COVID 19 vaccine management.**The anticipated base compensation range for this position is $75,000-85,000* *USD annually.**The actual base pay offered to the successful candidate will be based on multiple factors, including but not limited to job-related knowledge/skills, experience, geographical location, and internal equity. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at the high end of the range for their role at Smith + Nephew. Compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each position and candidate.**In addition to base pay, we provide competitive bonus and benefits, which include medical, dental, and vision coverage, 401k, tuition reimbursement, medical leave programs, and a variety of wellness offerings.*
You. Unlimited.
We believe in creating the greatest good for society. Our strongest investments are in our people and the patients we serve.
This is where you belong.* Inclusion, Diversity and Equity- Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity, Learn more about Employee Inclusion Groups on our website (https://www.smith-nephew.com/)
* Your Future: 401k Matching Program, 401k Plus Program, Discounted Stock Options, Tuition Reimbursement
* Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Paid Holidays, Flex Holidays, Paid Community Service Day
* Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account (Employer Contribution of $500+ annually), Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave, Fertility and Adoption Assistance Program
* Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, Mentorship
* Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!


Smith+Nephew provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

We're more than just a company - we're a community! Follow us on LinkedIn to see how we support and empower our employees and patients every day.

title: Principal
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an exceptional and dedicated Principal to lead our educational institution. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background, leadership skills, and a passion for inspiring students to reach their full potential. As a Principal, you will oversee the day-to-day operations of our school, ensuring a safe, supportive, and engaging learning environment for all students.

Responsibilities:

- Develop and implement comprehensive educational programs that align with our school's vision and mission.  
- Oversee curriculum development and ensure that all instructional programs meet or exceed state and national standards.  
- Foster a collaborative school culture that promotes teamwork, respect, and open communication among students, staff, and parents.  
- Supervise and evaluate the performance of teaching staff, providing guidance and support as needed.  
- Manage school budgets, allocating resources effectively to support student learning and school operations.  
- Conduct regular classroom visits to assess instructional strategies and provide feedback to teachers.  
- Engage in strategic planning to improve student outcomes, increase parental involvement, and enhance community partnerships.  
- Represent the school at local, state, and national events, serving as a liaison to various stakeholders and promoting the school's mission and values.  
- Develop and implement fundraising initiatives to support school programs and activities.  
- Provide public speaking opportunities to promote the school and engage with the community.

Requirements:

- A bachelor's degree in Education or a related field, with a master's degree preferred.  
- A valid teaching certification and a principal's certification.  
- Proven leadership experience, with a track record of driving academic success and promoting a positive school culture.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with students, staff, and parents.  
- Strong budgeting and financial management skills.  
- The ability to educate students and staff on school policies and procedures.  
- Experience in curriculum development and classroom management.  
- A commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.  
- A passion for education and a vision for creating a world-class learning environment.

Skills:

- Fundraising  
- Budgeting  
- Curriculum development  
- Supervising  
- Strategic planning  
- Public speaking  
- Manage  
- Leadership  
- Classroom  
- Educate

* 401(k)
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

title: 2025 ALLEX Global Planning, ALAM
description:
The science of electronics is transforming exponentially through innovation and connectivity around the planet. Every day, breakthroughs are making technologies – from micro-processors, memory chips and flat panels to photovoltaic cells – even smaller and more powerful, opening up countless new possibilities in how the world lives, works and connects. Air Liquide Advanced Materials grows by enabling our customers to innovate. Our ALOHA™ and Voltaix® products are critical to the manufacturer of the newest computer chips required for Big Data and the Internet of Things.


**How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?**
-------------------------------------

Air Liquide is looking for new college graduates to be part of our Air Liquide Leading Excellence (ALLEX) Rotational Program. This program is designed to introduce new college graduates to the electronics specialty chemical industry.
  

  

ALAM Global Supply Chain team is looking for individuals to join the ALLEX - Global Supply Chain Specialist Rotational Program which is an 18 month program consisting of three 6 month rotations sponsored by ALAM Global Supply Chain team. Rotational opportunities will cover a minimum of 3 of the following 4 supply chain areas:
  

  

Global Planning
  

Global Logistics
  

Warehousing & Inventory Management
  

Mobile Asset Management
  

  

All rotations include a high level of collaboration offering active engagement across all organizational functions (Production, Quality, Planning, Logistics, Finance & Commercial) as well as 3rd party Vendors and international affiliates. Deliverables are highly quantitative with immediate business impact and benefits.
  

  

Following the successful completion of the program the ALLEX participant will be placed by their sponsored entity.
**Responsibilities:**

* **Meet or exceed the company safety standards.**
* **Become proficient in the operation and mission of each department and business you rotate through.**
* **Complete the rotation objectives for the above areas as specified by the rotation supervisor.**
* **Complete the required training as specified for all ALLEX.**
* **Prepare and submit a bimonthly report detailing objectives completed and any issues for that rotation.**
* **Complete additional assignments or projects at the request of the rotation supervisor.**

**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**
----------------------------------------

**Are you a MATCH?**
--------------------

* **Pursuing a bachelor's degree in Finance and/or Engineering**
* **Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA upon application and completion of degree**
* **Expected Graduation date of December 2024 or May 2025**
* **Program is designed for college graduates with less than one years of experience**
* **Previous co-op or intern experience is required**
* **Ability to work in a team environment**
* **Ability to prioritize multiple tasks from multiple sources**
* **Ability to integrate into a new setting within a relatively short period of time**
* **Ability to use Google programs such as Doc, Sheet, and Slide as well as Microsoft Word and Excel**
* **Ability to learn various PC programs**
* **Excellent written and verbal communication skills**
* **Ability to relocate in the US is required**
* **Ability to provide own daily transportation to/from work**
* **Business travel is required in some rotations**

**Salary / Benefits**

* **Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays.**

**International Considerations: Air Liquide regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.**

**PLEASE NOTE: Air Liquide will not accept resumes from third party vendors. Any resumes received from an agency through our website will be considered free of any fees or charges. We are an equal opportunity employer. Everyone will be considered for employment, promotions, transfers, and other conditions of employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental handicap, age, Vietnam era veteran status, disabled veteran status, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by state or federal law.**

**Our Differences make our Performance**

  

**At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.**

  

**We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.**

title: Director of Quality and Patient Safety
description:
**About Us:** Blythedale Children's Hospital is a leading pediatric hospital dedicated to providing comprehensive, compassionate care. As the only free-standing children's specialty hospital in New York State, we admit patients with complex medical conditions to our state-of-the-art 94-bed inpatient facility from academic medical centers across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. Located just twenty-five miles north of Manhattan in beautiful Westchester County, we offer an inspiring work environment where healthcare professionals thrive.

**Position Overview:** Reporting to the Chief Medical Officer, the Director manages and coordinates the Hospital’s Quality and Safety programs and is responsible for the day-to-day operation of the Quality Management Department. This position may be responsible for direct supervision of one or more professional and/or support service personnel.

**Qualifications:**

· Licensed NYS Registered Nurse or other clinical professional (e.g. Respiratory Therapist, Physical Therapist).

· Bachelor’s Degree required. Master’s Degree in a health-related discipline preferred (public health, healthcare administration, or business administration).

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Identifies process improvement and safety opportunities.

· Designs, implements, and evaluates quality and safety programs.

· Leads initiatives to improve outcomes in patient safety, patient satisfaction, clinical quality, and the environment of care.

· Collects data in a reliable and timely manner to demonstrate institutional compliance with external regulators and surveyors, including Joint Commission standards, CMS regulations.

· Prepares reports for presentation at clinical and administrative meetings.

· Under the direction of the CMO, oversees the Hospital’s Risk Management program. Implements and administers policies to ensure compliance and risk reduction.

· Trains and mentors staff in performance improvement and safety activities. Promotes and supports hospital safety culture.

**Physical Requirements:**

· Occasional prolonged standing/walking.

**Perks of Working at Blythedale:**

* **Competitive Salary:** We offer a salary that reflects your skills and experience.
* **Tuition Reimbursement & Continuing Education:** Support for furthering your education and career development.
* **Professional Development Opportunities:** Access to mentorship, leadership training, and career advancement programs.
* **Comprehensive Health Benefits:** Including medical, dental, and vision.
* **Retirement Plans with Employer Matching:** Secure your future with our strong retirement plans.
* **Paid Time Off (PTO):** Generous vacation, holiday, and sick leave policies.
* **Safe Work Environment:** Commitment to nurse safety and well-being.
* **Diversity and Inclusion Initiatives:** A workplace that values and supports all employees.

**Blythedale Children's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).**

title: Studio Coordinator
description:
Your Role
Join a fast paced, collaborative environment where all team members approach every challenge with a can-do spirit. Use your passion for service and attention to detail to help the Gensler team bring designs to life.
As a Studio Coordinator, you will provide administrative support to a team of industry-leading designers and architects. You enjoy helping others prioritize and manage their schedules. You're at the heart of your studio’s activities and the soul that keeps your studio and projects moving forward. Coordinators act as an ambassador for their studio and a liaison between their directors/principals, project teams and many others.
What You Will Do* Support Studio Directors and Principals with all administrative needs, including scheduling of meetings, expense reports, correspondence, travel arrangements, etc.
* Assist Studio Director with operational aspects of running the studio, including but not limited to, organizing studio meetings, weekly and monthly staffing, financial tracking, timecard and PTO tracking and approvals, proposal/presentation preparation, PDP (Professional Development Planning) coordination for studio team members and you.
* Assist Studio Directors and studio with administrative aspects of projects including project work and client coordination, design and image work for project proposals, qualifications packages, contracts, meeting notes, project filing, documentation support, and internal/external presentations.
* Coordinate client meetings with the hospitality team.
* Engage in office culture, plan studio meetings, retreats, outings, and celebrations.
* Work with the studio to maintain an organized studio space.
* Consistently provide a high level of customer service to Gensler staff, clients, vendors, business partners and guests while at times, being the client interface.
* Collaborate with other Studio Coordinators to cover Principals/Studio Directors/studios as needed and on special projects.
* Serve as back-up for reception occasionally and other Coordinators.


Your Qualifications* Must have at least 3-5 years of experience in an administrative support position
* Bachelor’s degree is required
* Experience in a professional service firm preferred
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint), Microsoft Teams, Tableau is a plus
* Strong knowledge of Adobe InDesign required – Miro is a plus
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to multi-task and prioritize required
* Excellent verbal and written communication a must
* Ability to communicate and interact effectively with all levels of management
* Exceptional customer service orientation
* Must be self-motivated, resourceful and entrepreneurial

* Please submit your resume as a PDF, Word documents will not be accepted

*\\*\\*The base salary range will be estimated between $62k-77,500 plus bonuses and benefits and contingent on relevant experience.*
Life at Gensler
At Gensler, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From curated art exhibits to internal design competitions to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.
We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability, wellness programs, flex spending, paid holidays, and paid time off. We also offer a 401k, profit sharing, employee stock ownership, and twice annual bonus opportunities. Our annual base salary range has been established based on local markets.
As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: STORE MANAGER
description:
Store Family Dollar  

  

Family Dollar wants you to join our team of, energetic, and hard-working associates and leaders! We are seeking **Full-Time Store Managers** for full time opportunities in a fast paced work environment!
  

  

Work where you love to shop! Family Dollar is hiring in your neighborhood. Avoid long commutes and set your own course to success by applying today.  

  

We offer generous benefits, flexible work schedules and the ability to work today and get paid tomorrow.  

  

Family Dollar Store Managers provide leadership, sales management and customer service in all aspect of managing a Family Dollar store. They are responsible for building strong teams to support the communities we serve.  

  

**THE VALUE YOU ADD:**  

  

Drive results of business operations  

Leading/Development of Store Associates
  

Driving Sales  

Leading Great Customer Service  

Asset Management  

Close Community Partnership  

Bring relevant solution to the business  

  

**WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU**?  

  

Thriving Culture based on Teamwork  

National Fortune 150 Company
  

Career Advancement Opportunities  

Training and Development
  

Define your earning potential in our pay for performance environment  

  

  

  

***Skills & Competencies:*** Results Driven, Communication Skills, Relationship Management.  

  

**Position Requirements****:**  

  

***Education:*** High school graduation or equivalent experience preferred.
  

  

***Experience:*** Retail Management experience preferred.  

  

***Physical Requirements:*** Ability to regularly lift up to 40 lbs. (and occasionally, up to 55 lbs.) from floor level to above shoulder height; must be able to meet demands of frequent walking, standing, stooping, kneeling, climbing, pushing, pulling, and repetitive lifting, with or without reasonable accommodation.  

  

***Availability***: Ability to work flexible, full-time schedule to include days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.  

  

  

  

Family Dollar proudly offers our store managers with an opportunity to earn a bonus each month if key performance goals are achieved.  

  

We value our Associates' contributions to our success, which drives us to invest in the most important element of our organization: our people.
  

As we work towards a healthier future, we provide eligible associates with the following:  

Health and welfare programs including medical, pharmacy, dental, and vision  

Employee Assistance Program  

Paid Time Off  

Retirement Plans  

Employee Stock Purchase Program  

  

We are required to obtain individual licenses for those of our stores that sell alcohol and/or tobacco. As a manager, you may be required by the local jurisdiction where a store is situated to provide certain detailed background information necessary to obtain a license to sell alcoholic beverages / tobacco products. While some of the required information may seem outdated or unnecessary, we must comply with these requirements in order to obtain an alcohol / tobacco license which often increases revenue, drives sales and improves bonus Potential. You will receive full training regarding any applicable rules and regulations and, while you will be required to provide the information needed for any permit or application, all required documents will be prepared for you by our professionals.  

  

  

  

Dollar Tree and Family Dollar are Equal Opportunity employers.

description:
The **New York Center For Child Development** is currently seeking a **Part-Time Teacher Aide** to assist in our Special Class in an Integrated Setting (half general education/half special education) preschool classroom at our **Delancey St., Manhattan and Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn Site.** This Teacher Aide will assist the head teacher and teacher assistants to manage the instruction and regulations of the classroom.

This is a 12 hour/week position, Part-Time

Compensation is $20-$25/hour

Hours are flexible but need to be within the school day: 8:30am-3:30 pm M-F

**Requirements:**

* High School Diploma or GED
* Experience with young children preferred
* Ability to work in a team environment

**Teaching (Knowledge and Skills):** 

* Become familiar with class curriculum.
* Become familiar with the goals and objectives of children’s IEPs. Engage with the students at their developmental level throughout the day.
* Participate in Team meetings.
* Be aware of children’s needs and behaviors and bring unusual occurrences to teacher’s attention.
* Consistently utilize classroom/ behavior management strategies throughout the day.
* Assist children with bathroom skills i.e. changing diapers, supervising toileting, washing hands, pulling clothing up and down. Use universal precautions during these tasks.
* Assist children with meals and snacks. Converse with students while they are eating.
* Engage in discussions with the teaching team when unsure and/or when you have ideas to assist children.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Preschool: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Kickstart Your Success: Entry Level Engagment Sales Role for Go-Getters
description:
At DMI we believe that experiences and relationships are what drive marketing and sales success for any company. We want you to help the brands we work with make an impact. We are engagement marketing/sales specialists with decades of industry experience behind us.

**Company Overview:**

Join our vibrant team at DMI Group where we believe work should be more than just a job - it should be an opportunity for growth and developing your skills. We are committed to fostering a dynamic, inclusive culture that values innovation, collaboration, and individual growth.

**Why Join Us:**

-Dynamic Culture: Experience a workplace where creativity and collaboration thrive. Our culture is built on diversity, inclusion, and a shared commitment to success.

-Training and Development: We invest in your growth with comprehensive training programs and continuous learning opportunities.

-Team Spirit: Enjoy a supportive team environment that celebrates wins together and fosters a spirit of camaraderie.

-Career Advancement: This is not just a job, it’s a stepping stone to a fulfilling career. We believe in promoting from within and providing a clear path for advancement.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Engage with potential customers to understand their needs and present tailored solutions
* Collaborate with team members to strategize and achieve sales targets

**What You Bring :**

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Team Player mentality with positive and proactive attitude
* Sales experience or a strong interest in sales
* Excellent negotiation skills
* Knowledge of outside sales techniques and strategies
* Exceptional work ethic and be able to work independently. We never have and never will micro-manage our team so you must be self driven

We offer competitive pay, opportunities for career growth, and a supportive work environment. If you are enthusiastic, customer-focused, and have a passion for sales, we would love to hear from you!

Please note that this is an entry-level position with opportunities for advancement within our company. No prior retail sales experience is required, but a willingness to learn and grow is essential.

To apply, please submit your resume highlighting your relevant skills and experience. We will contact qualified candidates for further consideration.

title: Regulatory Data Associate
company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems.  

  

The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.
What we do:
The Data & Statistics Function’s mission is to increase utility and ability to leverage financial data through standardization, thoughtful collection design, and increase capacity of the Function to scale operations. You will be part of the Financial Analysis Services Team (FAST) covering International and Domestic Markets (IDM). The FAST team is responsible for performing data analysis, building out and managing analytical products and ongoing stakeholder and respondent management on interpretive reporting topics. You will be a part of the Treasury International Capital (TIC) team within the larger Financial Analysis Services Team (FAST), responsible for performing data analysis, building out and managing analytical products and responding to ongoing stakeholder and firm inquiries related to interpretive reporting topics. Specifically, the team primarily provides services focusing on data quality assurance and analysis of TIC data received from U.S. financial institutions.
Your role as Regulatory Data Associate:* Independently conduct data analysis and visualizations, develop questions that resolve data quality anomalies, and research interpretive inquiries for complex data series, reporters, and data concepts. This includes providing respondents and stakeholders guidance on technical reporting issues;
* Perform extended analysis and question respondents on data quality items of note related to complex reports and institutions. Establish and lead dialogue with financial institutions to enhance data quality and controls;
* Summarize multiple sources of information concerning data collections and relationships of varying sizes and degrees of complexity to produce well-supported and influential analyses and inquiries.
* Participate and collaborate on automation efforts and new technology solutions, expanding our technology platform capabilities to increase self-service, enhance resiliency and improve efficiency;
* Research inquiries and reporting issues and propose sound conclusions based on reporting instructions and guidance;
* Build effective working relationships stakeholders; assess and respond to requests on data collection operations and analysis of institutions’ reporting practices;
* Participate in Function and System workgroups as assigned


What we are looking for:* Strong experience in business intelligence, financial markets and products, regulatory reporting, or data analytics.
* Experience in a financial, economic, or analytic role.
* Demonstrated understanding of U.S. and global capital and money markets structure and products (e.g., Equities, Private Equity, Repo, Agency MBS, etc.);
* Demonstrated experience in analytical, problem solving, critical thinking, operational excellence, communication (written and verbal), stakeholder management, interpersonal, and self-management skills.
* Ability to provide efficient and accurate verbal and written analysis;
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Power Point. Familiarity and interest in Tableau, SQL, Alteryx or similar technical experience.


Application Deadline: September 13, 2024
Salary Range: $105000 - $120000 / year*We believe in transparency at the NY Fed. This salary range reflects a variety of skills and experiences candidates may bring to the job. We pay individuals along this range based on their unique backgrounds. Whether* *you’re* *stretching into the job or are a more seasoned candidate, we aim to pay competitively for your contributions*.  

Our Touchstone Behaviors—Communicate Authentically, Collaborate Inclusively, Drive Progress, Develop Others, and Take Ownership—help shape the culture of the Bank. They also provide a shared language for how we work together and achieve success, and they set clear expectations for leading with impact at every stage of your career with us. Learn more.

* Comprehensive Insurance Plans (Medical, Dental and Vision including Flexible Spending Accounts and HSA)
* Subsidized Public Transportation Program

Please email us at* ny.leaves@ny.frb.org *and* *we’ll* *be glad to help.* *Please note, this is a dedicated e-mail box designed exclusively to* *assist* *applications with accommodation requests in relation to our recruiting process. title: Medical Receptionist/Front Desk
description:

description:
**Homeless Shelter Community Tech**

**Job Description:**

Assist in monitoring this residential program for individuals experiencing homelessness, with a focus on maintaining a safe environment. Be part of a team with a commitment to engaging individuals in an approachable and empathetic manner while performing rounds and addressing the varied needs of individuals experiencing homelessness. You will manage conflict or challenging behaviors with self-awareness, emphasizing safety and building trust while understanding each person's unique experience. This position is subject to mandatory overtime.

**Schedule: 11:00pm to 7:30am**

**Salary: $16 - $18 per hour**

* Screening residents and visitors at front door.
* Create written documentation, including logbook entries, incident reports and progress notes.

* Assist with inspections and audits.
* Escort clients and serve meals as needed.
* Help maintain an orderly and clean facility.
* Patrol residence and report any observations leading to loss or damage of property.
* Monitor resident activities and act to restore order if needed.
* Make out reports as required.
* Act as escort for residents.
* Screen calls and visitors.
* Monitor the self-administration of medication.
* Complete incident reports in AWARDS.
* Prepare the following as needed: laundry schedule, census update, case assignments, roll call sheet, and client probation list.
* Help maintain transition and facilities logs.
* Monitor roll call sheet.
* Wake clients in the morning.
* Make periodic inspections of clients’ rooms.
* Provide emergency first aid/CPR assistance when needed.

**Qualifications:** 

* HS Diploma/ GED Required
* Computer literacy
* NYC Fire Safety Cert.
* Bilingual preferred
* Experience working with MICA homeless preferred
* Security guard license preferred

title: Residential Coordinator
description:
**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Morris, Bergen, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

We are currently seeking a **Full Time Residential Coordinator** for our programs in **Morris County, and Warren County**. The Residential Coordinator will oversee group homes serving individuals with developmental, intellectual and physical disabilities.

Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree required.
* Required to pass all background screening including, drug screening, fingerprinting, reference check, and physical/PPD, CARI checks.
* This position reports to the Assistant Residential Director and Residential Director.

**Role of a Coordinator:**

* Through supervision of the group home managers, assure quality of training and supervision of group home consumers.
* Through supervision of the group home managers, responsible for the physical welfare of the consumers.
* Responsible for assisting the Managers with financial running of the house.
* Responsible for the coordination of the maintenance of the facility.
* The Residential Coordinator is to be in regular communication with the Residential Director about consumer behavior and programming within the home and consistently reviewing all records.
* Responsible for house compliance with DDD manual of Standards and for always maintaining the program in a manner appropriate for inspection.
* Assist in the development and implementation of the ISP.
* Ensure that all ISP goals and data are consistently completed.
* Responsible for reviewing monthly notes and assuring they are completed accurately.
* Responsible for participating in the implementation of behavior management plans as needed, utilizing techniques and supervising staff in the appropriate implementation of such.
* Responsible for ensuring that the house programs and physical environment provides a safe, enriched, and respectful atmosphere for the consumers.
* Be on call and responsible for handling all emergencies, as determined by Residential Director.
* Responsible for attending future trainings and meetings on an as needed basis and in a timely manner.
* Responsible for all other duties as assigned by the Residential Director.
* Agrees to fully cooperate with Avidd Management and DHS/DDD in any inspection or investigation.

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

* Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.
* Paid Training
* Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays
* Generous Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Sick pay

- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis principles and techniques

- Strong organizational skills for maintaining accurate treatment records and documentation

This is a challenging yet rewarding position that offers the opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals with developmental disabilities. If you are passionate about helping others and have the necessary qualifications, we encourage you to apply for this position.

title: Diesel Fluid/Lube Technician
description:
**Title of Position: Diesel Fluid Technician**  
**Shift: 2nd Shift- 2pm Start Time**

**Location: Belle Mead, NJ**  
**FLSA: Non Exempt** 

The Diesel Fluid/Lubrication Tech. will report to our stone quarry shop in Belle Mead, N.J. and spend their shift fueling, inspecting, and when applicable assist in the repair and maintenance of heavy quarry equipment and trucks. They will have a good working knowledge of tools, equipment. The nature of the work will require that the Fluid Tech**.** be able to spot problems associated with the equipment inspections. Fluid Tech**.** will demonstrate initiative, responsibility, have good interpersonal skills and be flexible/adaptive to a fast-paced and fluid business environment.

**Company Description**

Grow with us! The Silvi Group Companies have been working on expanding our “A” Team of employees since 1947! Our team has grown to 12 companies employing over 600 employees at 24 locations across New Jersey and eastern Pennsylvania Silvi is large enough to provide the stability you need, but small enough that you can feel your individual contribution to our success. We value the fresh ideas and perspective of each new member of our team.

Our employees contribute directly to our aggressive growth and we enjoy giving back by developing our employees with professional opportunities as well as a comprehensive benefits package. Our benefits includes excellent medical (health, Rx, dental, vision), personal time (vacation, sick, holidays) and a retirement package that not only includes a 401K plan but an almost extinct pension plan as well. We protect our employees’ futures by providing no cost disability and life insurance coverages with the option to purchase additional coverage as per their family's needs. Our close knit environment develops a culture in which we work hard but get to know each and every employee that helps us build our future. If you are driven, creative, and want to see your contributions reflected in real time, come work for us!

**Position Essential Functions Responsibilities**

* Check oil, grease and fuel trucks and heavy equipment daily.
* Check coolant levels, transmission levels, hydraulic oil levels, & engine oil levels
* Fuel all equipment daily
* Power wash radiators
* Report any issues found to mechanic on duty
* Perform tire inspection and tire inflations on all equipment at location.
* Change tires.
* Assist the mechanic with preventative maintenance for heavy-duty diesel vehicles and equipment.
* Assist the mechanic with driver write up’s
* Maintain a safe and professional working environment.
* Uses, stores, records, safeguards and properly uses equipment, materials, parts and other supplies.
* Maintain shop and work area in a clean and organized manner.
* Fill out fueling sheets with mileage and hours daily
* Prepare reports and records of time spent, materials, parts used and work completed.
* Complete work assignments in the allotted time frame

**Qualifications**

* Successful completion of training in automotive technology at an accredited school and/or the equivalent experience as a mechanic in the repair of motorized vehicles and equipment preferred
* Able to work second shift.
* Ability to work independently.
* Ability to read and understand maintenance and parts manuals, and other written instructions related to the maintenance and repair of motor vehicles and equipment.
* Knowledge of safety regulations, i.e. OSHA, MSHA, DOT as they apply to the operation preferred.
* Possesses a sense of urgency and ownership

**Physical Demands**

* Use hands to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls.
* Stand for long periods of time.
* Kneel, stoop, crouch, or crawl.
* Hear sounds and recognize the difference between them.
* Make quick, precise adjustments to machine controls.
* Use fingers to grasp, move, or assemble very small objects.
* Make fast, repeated movements of fingers, hands, and wrists.
* Use one or two hands to grasp, move, or assemble objects.
* Use muscles to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects.
* Use stomach and lower back muscles to support the body for long periods without getting tired.
* Bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Move two or more limbs together (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while remaining in place.
* Hold the arm and hand in one position or hold the hand steady while moving the arm.
* See details of objects that are less than a few feet away.
* Use muscles to jump, sprint, or throw objects.
* Use muscles for extended periods without getting tired.
* Be physically active for long periods without getting tired or out of breath.
* Determine from which direction a sound came.
* See differences between colors, shades, and brightness.
* Quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Focus on one source of sound and ignore others.
* Lift 50 pounds regularly

No smoking is permitted on or within company property, including inside trucks, buildings, or anywhere on the premises.

**Benefits**

Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision, Pension, Short and Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, Competitive Pay, Overtime

title: Data Entry/Billing Clerk
description:
**Caseworker/Data Entry/Billing Clerk**

**Responsibilities**

· Checks in the NJMMIS (Emevs) system if the client has active Medicaid

· Daily interviews the new clients by phone and verifies the information entered by Intake for quality control of the Newark or Secaucus residential programs to finish the official admission to CURA using the NJSAMS-web based system

· Informs Intake dept. of any missing, wrong information in need of correction.

· Processes PE (Medicaid Presumptive Eligibility applications for the new eligible clients

· Requests or secures the initial or ongoing authorizations according to the funding source.

· Daily cleans up the NYSAMS message queue where the IME notify the status of the authorizations requested. Once approved, enters the authorizations in the corresponding excel list and in Zoobook.

· Submits tickets if applicable through the NJSAMS system if there are problems securing the PA and follows up with the status

· Processes PE or help clients to call NJ First/Family Care to reestablish Medicaid.

· Beginning of week prepares a new due ERL list to be distributed to each of the programs

· Submits some of the due ERL in the NJSAMS.

· Sorts, distributes and makes copies of the clients’ correspondence pertaining to their health insurance.

· Sometimes goes to the Intake department to pick up new clients’ chart.

· Maintain ongoing communication with Newark or Secaucus programs regarding clients change funding sources, discharge dates, ERL status

· Updates funding sources in Zoobook if necessary

· On a daily basis, bills FFS Newark and Secaucus clients using NJ-DAS.

· Reviews daily, the Suboxone list submitted by the Medical Dept. to make Zoobook appointments of Medicaid active for Newark or Secaucus clients.

· Generate and submit Medicaid billing in Zoobook every 3 days.

· Sometimes if instructed; process the CCF on the NJMISS website.

· Fill out in Zoobook the Medicaid paid claims

**Qualifications**

· Associates degree in Accounting.

· Minimum of 2 years’ **experience** in Data Entry, billing or accounting role

· Experience with Billing Softwares, Zoobook, Quickbooks, NJ-DAS/NJMISS knowledge a Plus.

· Bilingual Speaking Preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* Accounting: 2 years (Required)
* Data entry: 2 years (Required)
