title: Biosafety Officer
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Biosafety Officer
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** IPO-Envir. Health & Safety
  

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.
  

**Posting Summary**
“Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Biosafety Officer for the Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) reporting to Rutgers Environmental Health and Safety (REHS). The Biosafety Officer is the designated official to ensure compliance with various laws, regulations, standards, guidelines, policies, and procedures in laboratories and other settings where biological and chemical hazards may be present.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* The position will assist in providing oversight for BSL3/ABSL3 operations as an Alternate Responsible Official.
* Supports researchers and others in developing standard operating procedures and protocols for research, maintains and updates the Biosafety Manual, and works to create consistency across plans and procedures.
* The Biosafety Officer maintains and participates in constructive and positive communications, and works with the University’s Laboratory Safety Committees, Institutional Animal Care and Use Committees (IACUC), Institutional Biosafety Committees (IBC), and Institutional Research Boards (IRB) to ensure compliance with the National Institute of Health (NIH), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and other standards for recombinant DNA and vaccine research, as well as other applicable laboratory safety regulations or guidelines.
* The position reviews research protocols and activities, conducts periodic inspections of research facilities, and is responsible for reporting significant problems and violations of applicable laboratory safety and biosafety requirements.
* The Biosafety Officer is a leader within the department and institution.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 30S
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 87284.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 105194.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 125233.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** HPAE 5094
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Biological Sciences, Chemistry, or Industrial Hygiene and Safety or other related science.
* A minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience with a minimum of three (3) years of experience in the field of biological or laboratory safety.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required.
* Knowledge of laboratory safety practices and equipment including appropriate use of hoods and laboratory ventilation, personal protective equipment, and chemical safety and storage required.
* Demonstrated ability to respond to emergencies and critical situations appropriately in a research setting required.
* Must be able to walk/stand for extended periods of time, wear Self Contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA) and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) up to Level A, and provide emergency response services, as needed (including rotating on-call/off-hours services).
* Ability to prepare clear, accurate and informative reports containing findings, conclusions, and recommendations, along with superior oral presentation and other communications skills required.
* Use of the Internet for research purposes, and experience with computers (email, desktop software applications such as Office, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) required.
* Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and manage the successful completion of projects.
* Candidate must successfully complete a security risk assessment by the U.S. Department of Justice and be approved for access to select biological agents and toxins by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)/Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) as a condition of employment.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s Degree
* CBSP or RBP certification


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
**PHYSICAL****DEMANDS****:** Standing, sitting, walking, talking or hearing. No special vision requirements.  

  

**WORK****ENVIRONMENT****:** Laboratory environment, animal facilities and BSL3/ABL3
  

**Special Conditions**
  

Posting Details
**Posting Number** 24ST0715
  

**Posting Open Date** 03/27/2024
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**

**Home Location Campus** Rutgers University-Newark

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**

Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Emergency Department Pediatric Nurse -EDPN24-04310
description:
**Position:** Emergency Department Pediatric Nurse  

**location:** Edison, NJ  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Job Summary:**



Our Emergency Department Pediatric Nurses are integral members of our healthcare team, responsible for providing specialized and innovative care to pediatric patients during critical situations. Equipped to handle a variety of emergency scenarios, our ED RNs must be ready to respond quickly and decisively to ensure the best possible outcomes for our young patients. From assessing incoming pediatric patients to prioritizing their injuries and medical needs, our ED nurses play a vital role in delivering quality care when it matters most.


**Required Skills & Experience:**


* Minimum 18 months of Nursing experience working specifically in a pediatric Emergency Department environment.
* Demonstrated level of performance and practice in pediatric emergency nursing.
* Recent ED experience within the past six months.
* Clinical knowledge and analytical abilities necessary to formulate effective nursing care plans for pediatric patients.
* Ability to perform a wide variety of professional nursing services, including but not limited to, triaging patients, administering medications, and providing emergency interventions.
* Strong communication skills to effectively interact with pediatric patients, their families, and hospital personnel during high-stress situations.

title: Pediatric Emergency Room Nurse -PERN24-02739
description:
**Title:** Pediatric Emergency Room Nurse  

**Location:** Edsion, NJ  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Job Summary:**



As a Pediatric Emergency Room Nurse, you'll be at the forefront of providing compassionate and specialized care to children experiencing a wide range of medical emergencies. You'll work alongside a dedicated team of professionals, utilizing innovative technologies and evidence-based practices to deliver exceptional care in a fast-paced environment.


**Responsibilities:**


* **Provide timely and comprehensive assessment and care** to pediatric patients with diverse physical and mental health needs, prioritizing and responding effectively to critical situations.
* **Administer medications, perform procedures,** and collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement individualized treatment plans.
* **Maintain a calm and reassuring presence** for patients and families during stressful situations, providing clear communication and emotional support.
* **Stay abreast of current trends and practices** in pediatric emergency medicine through ongoing education and training.
* **Contribute to a positive and collaborative team environment** by readily assisting colleagues and promoting a culture of safety and excellence.


**Qualifications:**


* **Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New Jersey.**
* **Minimum of 18 months of experience** working in a pediatric emergency department setting.
* **Demonstrated skill and proficiency** in delivering high-quality patient care in a fast-paced, critical environment.
* **Strong clinical knowledge and analytical ability** to assess patient needs and formulate effective care plans.
* **Excellent communication and interpersonal skills** to collaborate effectively with patients, families, and healthcare professionals.
* **Ability to work independently and as part of a team,** demonstrating flexibility and adaptability.
* **Proven commitment to patient safety and ethical nursing practice.**


**Education:**


* Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred; Associate of Science in Nursing (ASN) with relevant experience considered.


**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement
* Positive work environment with a dedicated team
* The chance to make a real difference in the lives of children and families


**Note:**


* This job description is just a sample and may need to be tailored to the specific needs of your hospital.
* You can add additional information about your hospital and its commitment to pediatric care.
* You can also include a section on preferred skills and experience, such as specific certifications or languages.

title: Registered Nurse - Med Surg/Tele - RNMSTELE24-03783
description:
**Title:** Registered Nurse - Med Surg/Tele  

**Location:** Hackensack, NJ  

**Duration:** 2 Months


**Job Summary:**


* The Registered Nurse is responsible for evaluating patients and assisting physicians with patient care.
* Plans, implements, and documents nursing care based on patient’s needs.
* Identifies patient needs and determines priorities for care through assessment, planning, intervention, and evaluation.
* Develops, implements and coordinates individualized plan of care for patients assigned through initial and on-going assessments.
* Initiates assessment based on the patient’s problems or needs, the physician’s medical diagnosis, and the functional health framework.
* Performs therapeutic nursing interventions. Manages care of patients.
* Documents care based on standards of care and practice, patient acuity, and/or clinical priorities.
* Advocates for evidence-based practice care standards and supports adoption of evidence-based practices and innovations in care delivery.
* Provides patient centric care in alignment with professional nursing practice model. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


**DEPT: Cardiovascular-Surgical-****Over 2 Years of Experience, surgical and tele.**


**Required Education:** ASN.


**Preferred Education:** BSN.


**Required Certifications & Licensure:**


* BLS must be AHA.
* NJ State Professional Registered Nurse license or multi-state compact license.
* ACLS
* NIHSS
